SENT.plain: Three cases of deep cerebral venous thrombosis in children are presented, and the cranial computed tomographic (CT) findings and angiographic findings reviewed
Two patients had findings indicative of brain death at the time of initial CT examination
The third patient recovered without neurological sequelae
Noncontrast-enhanced CT examinations showed abnormally dense-appearing deep venous structures, mimicking a contrast-enhanced study
On the arteriogram the deep venous system failed to opacify, and multiple collaterals to the superficial venous system were formed
